page.title: 11THE LAKES NATIONAL PARK
page.content: The{Lake District National Park covers 2279sq. kms of{Cumbria.}The western half of our block is in the park. The county has great attraction to tourists. The National Park is set up mainly for the benefit of visitors but also for residents who care for it. The{Lake District Special Planning {Board}administers new building and redevelopment and other facets which may change the area's appearance. It bears in mind the diverse needs of {tourists, residents, farmers and {wildlife.}Usually, this has little effect on farmers who can exercise similar activities to any other farmers. The National Park status does not imply that all land within its boundary is open to the public. There are hundreds of miles of public footpaths through the valleys and the felltops have almost open access.
